triplets: Sports equipment designed for use in the game of American football
Playing American football, passing, kicking, and scoring touchdowns in competitive or recreational games
Leather or synthetic leather for the outer cover, rubber or latex for the inner bladder, stitching materials such as polyester or nylon
Outer leather or synthetic cover that provides grip and durability
Inner rubber or latex bladder that holds air and maintains shape
Laces stitched on the surface to assist with throwing and grip
Traditionally brown with white laces, but can include white stripes, logos, or custom colors depending on manufacturer or league
American football games, sports leagues (e.g., NFL, college football), practice equipment, recreational sports
Various sporting goods manufacturers such as Wilson, Nike, Under Armour, and other regional brands
Approximately 410–460 grams depending on size and league specifications
Approximately 11 inches (28 cm) long, with a circumference of about 22 inches (56 cm) at the widest point
Typically 1–5 years depending on frequency of use, quality of materials, and maintenance
